Module JBubbleBobble2
Package BubbleBobble.model

Class Level

java.lang.Object
BubbleBobble.model.Level
public class Level extends Object
The Level class represents a single level in the game. It manages the various game objects, handles collisions, updates positions, and controls the flow of the game level, including whether the game is over or ready to change levels. It also handles adding and removing collidable objects, such as monsters, fruits, platforms, and more.

    • Level

      public Level()

  • Method Details

    • addCollidable

      public void addCollidable(Collidable c)
      Adds a collidable object to the level.
      Parameters:
      c - The collidable object to add.

    • removeCollidable

      public void removeCollidable(Collidable c)
      Removes a collidable object from the level.
      Parameters:
      c - The collidable object to remove.

    • changePause

      public void changePause()
      Pauses all of the collidable objects in the level.

    • setLevelScreen

      public void setLevelScreen(Image image, boolean isGameScreen)
      Sets the screen image for the level. This is used for the main menu, game won screen, and game over screen. Adds quotes if it's the game over screen.
      Parameters:
      image - The image to set as the screen.
      isGameScreen - Flag indicating whether this is the game screen.

    • timePassed

      public void timePassed()
      Called on each clock tick of the LevelComponent's timer to update the level. This updates the positions of all collidables and checks for collisions.

    • isPlayable

      public boolean isPlayable()
      Checks whether the level is in a playable state.
      Returns:
      true if the level is playable, false otherwise.

    • overlapping

      public boolean overlapping(Collidable c1, Collidable c2)
      Updates the state of the level based on game progress. If there are no monsters left, the level is ready to change. If the hero has no lives left, the game over flag is set.

    • handleCheckCollision

      public void handleCheckCollision()
      Iterates through all collidables to check for collisions, including platform, enemy, bubble, and fruit collisions.

    • startMonsterCheckTimer

      public void startMonsterCheckTimer(Timer t, int index)
      Starts the timer to check for monsters. Adds new monsters periodically and tracks the number of added monsters.
      Parameters:
      t - The timer to schedule periodic checks.
      index - The current index or stage of the monster check.
